org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
SAM PLASTINO, vs. HENRY M. WHITE, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at Seattle, Washington.
STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF SPOKANE ))) SS.

John King, Being first duly sworn, on oath says: That he is a practicing attorney in the city of Spokane, Washing- ton, a member of the firm of Tolman & King, attorneys for the petitioner in the above-entitled cause; that on the 27th day of July, 1916, he, at the office of Henry M. White, Esquire, United States Commissioner of Im- migration, at Seattle, Washington, examined the record of said commissioner in the proceedings set forth in Exhibit "C", attached to the original pe- tition herein; that he particularly examined the record of the pretended examination of Sam Plastino before I. M. Fisher, Esquire, and Charles R. Keagy, Esquire, at Tacoma, Washington, on January 26, 1912, and upon such examination discovered that the last eight lines of said pretended exami- nation as set forth therein, beginning with the words "Q. You have a right to be represented by counsel if you desire, " and ending with the words "A. Yes. sir," appeared in the said record in ink different in kind and character from the portion of the remainder of said record preceding said eight lines: that said eight lines appear to heve been written therein at
a time different from and subsequent to the said preceding portion of said record; that affiant then and there inquired of the custodian of said record if he could explain why said eight lines were written in ink different from the preceding portion, and affiant was then and there informed by said party that he could not explain said difference.
John King SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO Before me this 31st day of July, 1916.
Charles F. Sechrist Notary Public for the state of Washington, residing at Spokane, Washington.
